overview: This subject provides an introduction to the essential skills for the management of business data to enable the application of analytics and evidence-based decision-making in business. It entails the study of the principles and tools for business data management and modelling. The focus of the subject is enabling business decision-making, and includes consideration of effective presentation and reporting of business data. Data sets will be drawn from multiple industries and business disciplines (accounting, economics, finance and management & marketing).
ilo: Collect and compile business data from multiple sources
Manage common issues in the manipulation of business data of different types (e.g., timestamp, textual data)
Define appropriate business metrics and variables for a given data set
Explain the principles and issues involved in the effective presentation of business data for decision-making purposes
generic_skills: Evaluation of data and other information;
Accessing data and other information from a range of sources
Synthesis of data and other information;

Prerequisites.content: MC-MGMTAFN Master of Management (Accounting and Finance)

Prerequisites.content: Completion of a Bachelor's Degree in Commerce (or related discipline i.e. Business, Accounting/Finance, Economics)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Four data projects, to be completed in groups of 3-4 students, with the expectation that all students contribute equally to all projects. Each student will contribute the equivalent of 3500 words for all four projects.

assessment.hurdle: To pass this subject students must pass the end of semester examination.

date_times.contact_hours: Two 1-hour lectures and two 2-hour workshops per week
One 1-hour lecture and one 2-hour workshop per week
